text: Type rules We do not do cover this approach in detail in this course — that takes place over in the course Syntax and semantics. Some simple examples of type rules are (PLUS) Ekej:int E Fleg zint Ek+ej+e, : int (VAR) Ekæ:tifE(æ)=t Think of such a collection of rules as the specification of a type checker. The rules are syntax-directed wrt. the formation rules of the abstract syntax, and so is a type checker.
